page.title: 08GUSTON VILLAGE AND SCHOOL
page.content: The settlement predates the Survey of 1086 in which it appeared as Gocistone a derivation of the earlier "Guosiges farmstead." There is now 1 church,1 pub,1 farmhouse,64 post war houses,15 older houses and numerous barns, garages and sheds. The loss of the village school and shop has led to a feeling of neglect amongst villagers. The school closed in 1981,it is now moved to newer buildings in the barracks 2kms away. Some parents choose to take their children across to St Margarets at Cliffe. Other youngsters join the secondary pupils for the journey down into Dover usually by car. The closure of the shop in 1981 was another blow to the community. 9 out of 10 people now drive into Dover to shop whilst the others shop near their place of work. 32 cars were parked on a Saturday am.
